isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Cylinder Head and Valves - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Valve Springs

svcsubproc.title: Clean Valve Springs
svcsubproc.para: Clean valve springs and seats. Use an appropriate brush, soap and water, or other non-caustic solution.

step1.para: Inspect valve springs for rust, pitting, and cracks.

Inspect both ends of spring at contact point between cutoff end of last coil and adjacent coil. Replace spring if cutoff end has worn a notch in adjacent coil. This condition can also be detected by compressing spring by hand and listening for a clicking sound. Clicking sound is caused by the wear notches. Replace springs that exhibit this clicking sound.
Measure each spring length on adjacent sides. Spring ends not flat and square should be replaced. Springs ends not flat or are out of square place a side load on stem causing rapid stem guide wear.

Measure valve spring tension with a Valve and Clutch Spring Tester (ZTSE2241)
. Measure maximum spring length for valve closed test load. Measure minimum spring length for valve open test load. See " Specifications ," for appropriate test load for valve open spring length and valve closed spring length for each spring. Any spring that exceeds maximum or minimum length should be replaced.
